item.title: Accounting for the Social Economic Impacts of Covid-19 on Farmers and Farming
item.description: The aim of this study is to investigate the social economic impacts of Covid-19 on farmers and farming in Indonesia. COVID-19 continues to cause turmoil and its social economic impact on farmers are recognized. However, there are few studies that seek to explore and measure these impacts. A mixed methods approach is used in the study to investigate how farmers perceive and manage risks associated with Covid-19 pandemic, coping strategies they adopt, impacts on their productivity and well-being.
